overview_of_class: Cash flow computations. Basic financial concepts (stocks, bonds, options, arbitrage, hedging) and put-call parity. Binomial tree models. Risk-neutral valuation. Random walk and Brownian motion as a tool of modeling fluctuations. Options pricing. Application of the central limit theorem. The Black-Scholes formula and partial differential equation. Numerical approximations. Prerequisites: 240 plus any 1 of 310-1, 311-1, 385, IEMS 202, or ECON 381-1. Some acquaintance with basic differential equations is desirable but not required.
name: Mathematical Models in Finance
subject: MATH
